result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superAgency.notes: All counts HELD OPEN - If defendant successfully completes all conditions of hold open agreement, defendant may petition to dismiss all counts.

judgments.dispoDesc: All counts HELD OPEN - If defendant successfully completes all conditions of hold open agreement, defendant may petition to dismiss all counts.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kerrie Lyn Hartley

records.addlTxt: JV2248447 - Body Only; Reviewable by Judge McCrory only unless unavailable then may be reviewed by any Circuit Court Judge.
9:08 AM Defendant Kerrie Lyn Hartley not in court.  Attorney Anne Theresa Nack in court for the State of Wisconsin. Warrant ordered, body only, review by Judge McCrory only.

9:02 AM Defendant Kerrie Lyn Hartley in court. Attorney Kyle Edward Johnson in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Status hearing scheduled for November 3, 2022 at 08:00 am.

2:43 PM Defendant Kerrie Lyn Hartley in court.  Attorney Michael Shannon Murphy in court for Kerrie Lyn Hartley.  Attorney Mason C Braunschweig in court for State of Wisconsin. Drug Court contract filed. Defendant pleads guilty to count 1 and no contest to counts 2, 3, and 4. All counts HELD OPEN - If defendant successfully completes all conditions of hold open agreement, defendant may petition to dismiss all counts. Defendant to participate in Drug Court.

Maintain absolute sobriety. Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only. Not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Bond becomes effective when signed at jail on October 18, 2022.

10:53 AM Defendant Kerrie Lyn Hartley in court, in custody. Attorney Michael Patrick Murphy in court for Kerrie Lyn Hartley.  Prosecuting attorney Kyle Edward Johnson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily. Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived. Court modifies bond to a $1000 Signature bond with same conditions: Maintain absolute sobriety. Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only. Not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Bond becomes effective when signed at jail on October 18, 2022. Matter continued to follow 22CM249.
Arraignment scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 17, 2022 at 10:45 am.

03:04 PM  Defendant Kerrie Lyn Hartley appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael Shannon Murphy appeared by video for Kerrie Lyn Hartley.  Prosecuting attorney David S Olson and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Preliminary hearing requested.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 10:45 am.

03:09 PM Defendant Kerrie Lyn Hartley appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Cuco Longoria appearing by video for attorney Michael Shannon Murphy. Prosecuting attorney Noah M Tylenda appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Matter continued at the request of attorney Michael Shannon Murphy.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

03:07 PM  Defendant Kerrie Lyn Hartley appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Refugio Cuco Longoria appeared by video for Kerrie Lyn Hartley.  Prosecuting attorney Margaret Nan Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. $500.00 cash bond set with conditions.  Adjourned initial appearance on September 30, 2022
Maintain absolute sobriety. Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only. Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.
Justice Point: Rock County Pretrial Risk Report
